item.title: Fed ‘Third Mandate’ Forces Bond Traders to Rethink Age-Old Rules
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- For generations on Wall Street, it was a statement of fact: The Federal Reserve’s “dual mandate” of price stability and maximum employment governed how it set interest rates, invoked time and again from Alan Greenspan to Jerome Powell. So when Donald Trump’s latest pick for Fed govern...
